comment.body: Is there a way to choose a port rather than IP? I use a private proxy to access ZeroNet, so that would be usefull.

> [jamesholden](#comment_10_12w3zJ6gRrcAw2kSCQXDkorgqxuXnkKkF8): I am not sure I understand your use case ? Where do you need to set the port rather than IP ? On your favorite zites ? The favorite zites field is freetext so anything put there will be tentatively translated by the browser (even clearnet sites) so there's no restrictions if you want to include a proxy URL I think.

The extension works only if the IP is 127.0.0.1, but I use a ZeroNet proxy, so the IP I use is 192.168.70.5 or my external IP, so it would be more useful for me if the IP could be anything (I don't have a static external IP), but a specific port (*:43110). But I could always use an SSH tunnel instead of port forwarding.

> [jamesholden](#comment_11_12w3zJ6gRrcAw2kSCQXDkorgqxuXnkKkF8): Ah, I see, thanks for clarifying ! It doesn't seems possible though, it's denied by the regex Firefox use to define the scope of the add-on :
> There was an error during installation: Extension is invalidReading manifest: Error processing content_scripts.0.matches.0: Value "http://*:43110" must either: be one of ["<all_urls>"], must either [match the pattern /^(https?|wss?|file|ftp|*):\/\/(*|*.[^/]+|[^/]+)\/.$/, or match the pattern /^file:\/\/\/.$/], or match the pattern /^resource:\/\/(*|*.[^/]+|[^/]+)\/.*$|^about:/

Oh well, I guess I'll use tunnels from now on.
